docreader.range.paragraph

Class ParagraphReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.range.paragraph.ParagraphReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>, RequirementReaderI

    public class ParagraphReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequirementReaderI
    Reads a single paragraph and stores the resulting text as XHTML (RichText) and plain text
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Format encountered field data and take care of intended side-effects (storing data away, creating new requirements etc.)

      Wrap a single paragraph with applicable styles

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParagraphReader

        public ParagraphReader(ReaderData readerData,
                       RequirementTemporary requirement,
                       org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Paragraph paragraph,
                       java.lang.String lastWordOfPreviousParagraph)
        Ordinary constructor
        Parameters:
        readerData - global readerData
        requirement - Requirement where to store links; results of reading process will not be stored there; instead they are available via getRawText() and getRichText()
        paragraph - Paragraph to Process
        lastWordOfPreviousParagraph - used for links in tables which span several paragraphs
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - one of the arguments was null or out of range

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public java.lang.Integer read()
        Reader for paragraphs.

        Note: This will also read empty paragraphs such as those resulting from a user who continuously hit return while crafting a document.

        Specified by:
        read in interface GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>
        Specified by:
        read in interface RequirementReaderI
        Returns:
        the number of paragraphs to skip (that is: 0-based number of paragraphs read)
        See Also:
        GenericReader.read()

      • getRichText

        public java.lang.String getRichText()
        Returns:
        text of paragraph with formatting applied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - paragraph has not been read, yet.

      • getRawText

        public java.lang.String getRawText()
        Returns:
        text of paragraph without any formatting applied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - paragraph has not been read, yet.

      • getFirstField

        public FieldStore<java.lang.Integer> getFirstField()
        Specified by:
        getFirstField in interface RequirementReaderI
        Returns:
        first printable field in this paragraph
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - paragraph has not been read, yet.
        See Also:
        RequirementReaderI.getFirstField()

      • absoluteStartOffsetForRawReader

        private int absoluteStartOffsetForRawReader()
        Determine the startOffset for the raw reader; necessary for fake list paragraphs
        Returns:
        the first absolute (document-wide unique) startOffset when the raw reader should start operation
